intro: Javieria venosa, commonly known as the slender rush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Javieria venosa is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity.
